messages.subject: Re: Yanone question
messages.msgSnippet: So yanone are not paperable by the NBTHK, never mind Juyo Token? How about both the NTHK? I was also thinking about the Umetada yanone. See this website:
messages.messageBody:
So yanone are not paperable by the NBTHK, never mind Juyo Token? How about both the NTHK?

I was also thinking about the Umetada yanone. See this website: http://www.arco-iris.com/George/umetada3.htm

and http://www.arco-iris.com/George/yanone.htm

Matt

From: Bob McCoy
To: token_kenkyu_kai@...
Sent: Monday, May 31, 2004 7:50 AM
Subject: RE: Yanone question


Hi Roger,



I know that Karita (the Polisher) tried to submit a carved Umetada

he Polished to the NBTHK and they would not look at it or any other yanone.



Regards,

Bob.






------------------------------------------------------------------------------

From: Roger [mailto:roger@...]
Sent: Sunday, May 30, 2004 8:54 PM
To: token_kenkyu_kai@...
Subject: Re: Yanone question



Hi All,


Bob McCoy is your man to ask.

Since there are a few Umetada Myoju yanone, I would guess there are some Juyo??




> Hi gang, I was wondering if yanone are paperable,
> and if anyone has ever heard of a juyo yanone?



Kind regards,

Roger

messages.subject: Yanone question
messages.msgSnippet: Hi gang, I was wondering if yanone are paperable, and if anyone has ever heard of a juyo yanone? Matt [Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
messages.messageBody:
Hi gang, I was wondering if yanone are paperable, and if anyone has ever heard of a juyo yanone?
Matt
